title.value: RARE OR RARELY DIAGNOSED? TREATABLE GENETIC SYNDROMES IN ADULT NEUROPSYCHIATRIC PATIENTS
title.justification: The title 'RARE OR RARELY DIAGNOSED? TREATABLE GENETIC SYNDROMES IN ADULT NEUROPSYCHIATRIC PATIENTS' is explicitly mentioned in the provided text.
title.quote: RARE OR RARELY DIAGNOSED? TREATABLE GENETIC SYNDROMES IN ADULT NEUROPSYCHIATRIC PATIENTS

extractions.description: This paper discusses the importance of recognizing treatable genetic disorders in adult neuropsychiatric patients, emphasizing the role of medical genetics and targeted treatments.

type.justification: The paper discusses practical applications and examples related to genetic conditions and their psychiatric symptoms, suggesting an empirical approach to research.
type.quote: This talk will focus on the importance of medical genetic evaluation in patients with psychiatric disease. It will first highlight the difference between complex inheritance and single gene disorders, and then summarize the referral criteria of our medical neuropsychiatric genetics clinic. Specific examples will be given of genetic conditions which can present with psychiatric symptoms, along with an overview of the genetic evaluation approach and standard diagnostic tests.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on the genetic evaluation for psychiatric conditions, which falls under the field of Medical Genetics.
name.quote: This talk will focus on the importance of medical genetic evaluation in patients with psychiatric disease.

name.justification: The paper covers genetic counseling and treatment for psychiatric conditions, situating it within the sub-field of Psychiatric Genetics.
name.quote: In this session, we will consider the application of genetic counseling in the context of psychiatric conditions.
